page.title: 03Places in Merebrow.
page.content: In Merebrow there is a P.O. which is owned by Mr. Sharples. Next door is the Smithy owned by John and Sam Moss who are brothers. It is an old building where people bring broken but mendable metal things and they mend them. Across the road is the Legh Arms quite a popular pub managed by Kenneth Morris. It has a big car park at the side. Near the Legh Arms there is a licensed restaurant called 'The Crab and Lobster'. Behind the restaurant is a small engineering workshop. Farther along the road is a Tea Shop which was once a bakery. Opposite there is a National Westminster Bank, which is open Mondays and Thursdays only. On the corner of Marshes Lane is a shop, a warehouse and corn mill belonging to the Ascroft family. Near the shop there is a village Institute.
